meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a majority.
meanings.sent1: The majoritarian opinion prevailed in the election.
meanings.sent2: The majoritarian view was widely accepted by the group.
meanings.sent3: The majoritarian decision on pizza toppings caused a stir at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her majoritarian influence over the team was undeniable.
meanings.sent5: The majoritarian nature of the event made it a true representation of the community.

meanings.definition: Supporting or advocating the rule or dominance of a majority.
meanings.sent1: The majoritarian candidate won the election by a large margin.
meanings.sent2: His majoritarian policies aimed to benefit the most people.
meanings.sent3: The majoritarian approach to dessert selection led to an abundance of chocolate cake.
meanings.sent4: Her majoritarian leadership style brought unity to the team.
meanings.sent5: The majoritarian principle guided the decision-making process for the committee.
